Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

Target_PDS3.target_desc:
Blue supergiant star, used for calibration by instruments on the New Horizons spacecraft.
Location, ICRS frame, J2000 epoch =================================
RA = 158.20279865 degrees Dec = +09.30658596 degrees
RA = 10 32 48.67168 h min s (sexagesimal) Dec = +09 18 23.7094 degrees min s (sexagesimal)
Location error ellipse at J2000 epoch =====================================
Major axis 1.76 mas Minor axis 0.97 mas Position angle 89 deg North to East
Proper motion =============
dRa/dt -5.93 mas y**-1 dDec/dt -3.40 mas y**-1
Proper motion error ellipse ===========================
Major axis 0.20 mas(y**-1?) Minor axis 0.11 mas(y**-1?) Orientation angle 0 deg
References ==========
VAN LEEUWEN F., Validation of the new Hipparcos reduction, 2007A&A...474..653V - Astron. Astrophys., 474, 653-664 (2007).
Source: Simbad web site
